Class JobQueue

                          +--nl.vu.pp.multithreaded.JobQueue
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.io.Serializable
public class JobQueue
extends java.util.LinkedList

This class implements the job queue for the multithreaded 15-puzzle implementation. It is used to distribute work among worker threads and to detect when all work has finished.

Unlimited jobs can be put in the queue that worker threads can pop from the queue and work on in parallel. When the last job has been put on the queue, the manager thread can invoke the join() method. This method will block until both the queue is empty and all threads have returned for more work. When the join() methods returns it means the algorithm has finished.

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 04.jan.2003
See Also:

Method Detail

push

public void push(Job job)
Adds a new job at the end of the list.

Parameters:
job - the job that is to be pushed on the queue.

pop

public Job pop()
        throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Returns the first job (oldest) in the queue. If the queue is empty, this method will block until another thread adds a job.

Returns:
the oldest job in the queue
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException

join

public void join(int waiters)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
This method blocks until both the queue is empty and all worker threads have entered the pop() method asking for more work. This is situation means all jobs have been executed and all worker threads are idle.
Invoke this method from the program's main thread to wait for the whole parallel algorithm to finish. In case of the 15-puzzle, the main thread may decide to increment the bound, restart the algorithm in case the first iteration did not yield any solutions.

Parameters:
waiters - the number of active workers you want to wait for.
java.lang.InterruptedException
